vialab.SMT

Class Zone

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.PGraphicsDelegate
      • vialab.SMT.Zone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener, processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonZone, ImageZone, KeyboardZone, SliderZone, TabZone, TextZone

    public class Zone
extends PGraphicsDelegate
implements processing.core.PConstants, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This is the main zone class which all other Zones extend. It holds the zone's coordinates, size, matrices, etc.. It was done with help from the tuioZones library.

    University of Ontario Institute of Technology. Erik Paluka, Summer Research Assistant (Summer 2011). Zach Cook, SurfNet Intern (2012-2013). With Dr. Christopher Collins collaborating with Dr. Mark Hancock.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Erik Paluka, Zach Cook

    • Method Detail

      • isDirect

        public boolean isDirect()
        Check state of the direct flag.

        The direct flag controls whether rendering directly onto parent/screen/pickBuffer (direct), or into an image (not direct) If drawing into an image we have assured size(cant draw outside of zone), and background() will work for just the zone, but we lose a large amount of performance.

        Returns:
        whether zone is rendering directly onto screen/pickBuffer, or not

      • setDirect

        public void setDirect(boolean direct)
        Change state of the direct flag.

        The direct flag controls whether rendering directly onto parent/screen/pickBuffer (direct), or into an image (not direct) If drawing into an image we have assured size(cant draw outside of zone), and background() will work for just the zone, but we lose a large amount of performance.

        Parameters:
        direct - controls rendering directly onto screen/pickBuffer, or not

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - The new name of the zone

      • loadMethods

        protected void loadMethods(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to load the methods from

      • loadMethods

        protected void loadMethods(java.lang.String name,
               boolean warnDraw,
               boolean warnTouch,
               boolean warnKeys,
               boolean warnPick,
               boolean warnTouchUDM)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to load methods from, used as a suffix
        warnDraw - Display a warning when the draw method doesn't exist
        warnTouch - Display a warning when the touch method doesn't exist
        warnKeys - Display a warning when the keyTyped/keyPressed/keyReleased methods don't exist
        warnPick - Display a warning when the pickDraw method doesn't exist
        warnTouchUDM - Display a warning when the touchUp/touchDown/touchMoved methods don't exist

      • beginTouch

        public void beginTouch()
        Call this to before matrix operations on a zone to make them apply when not in a touch method.

        Needs a matching endTouch() call to be made afterwards, otherwise the matrix stack will overflow with too many pushMatrix commands.

        Override this if something needs to occur before touch commands

      • endTouch

        public void endTouch()
        Call this to before matrix operations on a zone to make them apply when not in a touch method.

        Needs a matching beginTouch() call to be made beforehand, otherwise the matrix stack will underflow with too many popMatrix commands.

        Override this if something needs to occur after touch commands

        Parameters:

        public boolean contains(float x,
               float y)
        Tests to see if the x and y coordinates are in the zone. If the zone's matrix has been changed, reset its inverse matrix. This method is also used to place the x and y coordinate in the zone's matrix space and saves it to localX and localY.
        Parameters:
        x - float - X-coordinate to test
        y - float - Y-coordinate to test
        Returns:
        boolean True if x and y is in the zone, false otherwise.

      • rnt

        public void rnt()
        Rotate and translate.\n Single finger gesture, Which only translates inside of the rotation radius, and rotates and translates outside of this radius.\n Using a default radius of min(width, height)/4, A quarter of the smallest side of the zone. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch().

      • rnt

        public void rnt(float centreRadius)
        Rotate and translate. Single finger gesture, Which only translates inside of the rotation radius, and rotates and translates outside of this radius. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()
        Parameters:
        centreRadius - The rotation radius (how far out from centre before rotation is applied)

      • rnt

        public void rnt(Touch from,
       Touch to)
        Rotate and translate. Single finger gesture, Which only translates inside of the rotation radius, and rotates and translates outside of this radius. Using a default radius of min(width, height)/4, A quarter of the smallest side of the zone. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()
        Parameters:
        from - The Touch to translate from
        to - The Touch to translate to

       Touch to,

        Parameters:

      • clone

        public Zone clone(int cloneMaxChildGenerations)
        Clones the zone and optionally any child zones up to the specified generation of children
        Parameters:
        cloneMaxChildGenerations - - Max limit on how many generations of children to clone (0 - None, 1 - First Generation children, ... , Integer.MAX_VALUE - All generations of children)

        Parameters:
        in - The PVector to put into relative coordinate space
        Returns:
        A PVector relative to the zone's coordinate space
